packet_monitor.no_permission: You need both channels:read and messages:read permissions to view packet logs.
packet_monitor.count_tooltip: Showing {{shown}} most recent packets. Export will include all {{total}} packets.
packet_monitor.admin_only: Only administrators can clear packet logs
packet_monitor.confirm_clear: Are you sure you want to clear all packet logs?
packet_monitor.rate_limit_warning: Rate limit reached. Infinite scrolling paused for 15 minutes. Current packets will continue to update.
packet_monitor.settings.disabled_warning: Packet logging is currently disabled. No packets will be stored. Enable it in the section header above to start collecting packet data.
packet_monitor.settings.max_packets_desc: Oldest packets will be automatically deleted when this limit is reached (Range: 100-10,000)
packet_monitor.settings.keep_packets_des: Packets older than this will be automatically deleted (Range: 1-168 hours / 1 week)
packet_monitor.settings.cleanup_note: Automatic cleanup runs every 15 minutes to enforce these limits.
packet_monitor.settings.no_permission: You need settings:write permission to modify packet monitor settings.

api_token.description: Generate an API token to access the MeshMonitor REST API v1.
api_token.load_failed: Failed to load API token information

api_token.revoke_confirm: Are you sure you want to revoke this token? This action cannot be undone.
api_token.no_token: You don't have an active API token.
api_token.usage_instruction: Include the token in the Authorization header:
settings.max_node_age_description: Nodes older than this will not appear in the Node List
settings.inactive_node_threshold_descrip: Nodes that haven't been heard from for this many hours will trigger inactive node notifications (if enabled in Notifications tab)
settings.inactive_node_check_interval_de: How often to check for inactive nodes (1-1440 minutes, default: 60)
settings.inactive_node_cooldown_descript: Minimum time between notifications for the same node (prevents spam, default: 24 hours)
settings.sort_field_description: Default sorting field for the Node List on the main page
settings.sort_direction_description: Default sorting direction for the Node List on the main page
settings.date_format_description: Choose your preferred date display format
settings.temp_unit_description: Choose between Celsius and Fahrenheit for temperature display
settings.dist_unit_description: Choose between Kilometers and Miles for distance display
settings.telemetry_hours_description: How many hours of telemetry data to display in graphs (1-168)
settings.fav_telemetry_description: How many days to retain favorited telemetry data (7-90 days). Favorited telemetry is exempt from regular purge.
settings.map_tileset_description: Choose the map style for the network visualization
settings.map_pin_description: Choose the style of node markers on the map
settings.map_pin_meshmonitor: MeshMonitor - Pin markers with zoom-based labels
settings.map_pin_official: Official Meshtastic - Circle markers with always-visible labels
settings.theme_description: Choose from 15 themes including accessibility-focused options
settings.packet_monitor_description: Configure the mesh traffic monitor that displays all packets on the network. Requires both channels:read and messages:read permissions.
settings.hide_incomplete_description: Hide nodes missing name or hardware info. On secure channels (custom PSK), incomplete nodes haven't been verified as being on your channel.
settings.solar_monitoring_description: Configure solar panel monitoring for production estimates. Thanks to {{link}} for their Solar Estimates API!
settings.solar_latitude_description: North-south position on Earth (-90 south to +90 north)
settings.solar_longitude_description: East-west position on Earth (-180 west to +180 east)
settings.solar_declination_description: Panel angle from ground: 0=horizontal, 90=vertical. Typical: 20-40 degrees
settings.solar_fetch_description: Manually trigger a solar estimate fetch from Forecast.Solar. Estimates are automatically fetched every hour at :05 past the hour.
settings.settings_management_description: Changes are not applied until saved. Settings are stored on the server and persist across all browsers.
settings.danger_zone_description: These actions cannot be undone. Use with caution.
settings.erase_nodes_description: Removes all nodes and traceroute history from the database. A node refresh will be triggered to repopulate the list.
settings.purge_telemetry_description: Removes all historical telemetry data (battery, voltage, temperature, etc.). Current node states will be preserved.
settings.purge_messages_description: Removes all messages from channels and direct message conversations. This action is permanent.
settings.reset_traceroutes_description: Removes all saved traceroutes, traceroute history, and route segments (including record holders). New traceroutes will continue to be collected.
settings.restart_container_description: Restarts the Docker container. The system will be unavailable for approximately 10-30 seconds.
settings.shutdown_description: Shuts down MeshMonitor. You will need to manually restart it.
settings.save_failed: Failed to save settings. Please try again.
settings.reset_failed: Failed to reset settings. Please try again.
settings.confirm_reset_title: Are you sure you want to reset all settings to defaults?
settings.confirm_reset_affects: This will affect all browsers accessing this system.
settings.confirm_purge_nodes_title: Are you sure you want to erase all nodes and traceroute history?
settings.confirm_purge_nodes_item1: All node information will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_nodes_item2: All traceroute history will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_nodes_item3: A node refresh will be triggered to repopulate the list
settings.confirm_purge_telemetry_title: Are you sure you want to purge all telemetry data?
settings.confirm_purge_telemetry_item1: All historical telemetry records will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_telemetry_item2: Telemetry graphs will show no historical data
settings.confirm_purge_telemetry_item3: Current node states (battery, voltage) will be preserved
settings.confirm_purge_telemetry_item4: New telemetry will continue to be collected
settings.confirm_purge_messages_title: Are you sure you want to purge all messages?
settings.confirm_purge_messages_item1: All channel messages will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_messages_item2: All direct messages will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_messages_item3: New messages will continue to be received
settings.confirm_purge_traceroutes_title: Are you sure you want to reset all traceroutes?
settings.confirm_purge_traceroutes_item1: All saved traceroutes will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_traceroutes_item2: All traceroute history will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_traceroutes_item3: All route segments (including record holders) will be deleted
settings.confirm_purge_traceroutes_item4: New traceroutes will continue to be collected
settings.confirm_restart_title: Are you sure you want to {{action}} MeshMonitor?
settings.confirm_restart_docker: The container will restart automatically and be unavailable for approximately 10-30 seconds.
settings.confirm_restart_manual: MeshMonitor will shut down and will need to be manually restarted.

info.title: Device Information & Configuration
info.virtual_node_description: The Virtual Node Server allows multiple Meshtastic mobile apps to connect simultaneously, reducing load on your physical node.
info.virtual_node_note: Note: Admin commands are blocked for security. See .env.example for configuration details.
info.packet_stats_unavailable: Packet statistics not available. This device is sending HostMetrics (Linux-based device) instead of LocalStats.

config.warning_text: Modifying these settings can break your Meshtastic node configuration.
config.warning_description: These settings directly modify the configuration of your locally connected Meshtastic device. Incorrect settings may cause communication issues, network problems, or require a factory reset. Only modify these settings if you understand what you are doing.
config.import_export_description: Import or export channel configurations and device settings in Meshtastic URL format. These URLs are compatible with the official Meshtastic apps.
config.reboot_confirm:
Are you sure you want to reboot the device?

The device will restart and be unavailable for approximately 30-60 seconds.
config.rebooting: Rebooting device... This may take up to 60 seconds.
config.reboot_failed_reconnect: Device reboot initiated, but failed to reconnect. Please check connection manually.
config.reboot_failed_reconnect_toast: Device reboot initiated, but failed to reconnect
config.reboot_sent: Reboot command sent! Device will restart in 5 seconds.
config.purge_confirm:
Are you sure you want to purge the node database?

This will PERMANENTLY DELETE all stored node information from the device.
This action CANNOT be undone!

The device will automatically rebuild the database as it hears from nodes on the mesh.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.services_description: Enable or disable notification services. Both services use the same filtering preferences below.
notifications.apprise_description: Discord, Slack, Email, SMS, etc. (no HTTPS required)
notifications.filtering_description: These filters apply to both Web Push and Apprise notifications.
notifications.monitored_nodes_descriptio: Select which nodes to monitor for inactivity. You will only receive notifications for nodes in this list.
notifications.no_nodes_selected_warning: No nodes selected - you won't receive any notifications
notifications.server_events_description: Get notified about MeshMonitor server status changes:
notifications.server_events_startup: Server startup (includes version and enabled features)
notifications.server_events_disconnect: Node disconnection (when connection to Meshtastic node is lost)
notifications.prefix_with_node_name_desc: All notification messages will include the locally connected node name at the beginning, e.g., "[NodeName] Message text"
notifications.whitelist_description: Messages with these words will always send a notification (one per line):
notifications.blacklist_description: Messages with these words will never send a notification (one per line):
notifications.filter_priority_descriptio: Whitelist (highest) ‚Üí Blacklist ‚Üí Channel/DM settings. All matching is case-insensitive and checks for substrings.
notifications.https_required_text: Push notifications are not available over HTTP.
notifications.https_required_options: To enable push notifications, you must access MeshMonitor via:
notifications.https_option_ssl_desc: Set up SSL certificates (recommended for production)
notifications.https_option_localhost_des: Access via http://localhost for local testing
notifications.https_help_link: beginner-friendly guide to setting up free HTTPS with DuckDNS
notifications.pwa_no: No (add to home screen for iOS)
notifications.ios_text: On iOS (iPhone/iPad), push notifications require HTTPS and PWA installation:
notifications.ios_step3: Tap the Share button (square with arrow)
notifications.ios_step4: Scroll down and tap "Add to Home Screen"
notifications.ios_step5: Open MeshMonitor from your home screen
notifications.setup_description: Follow these steps to enable push notifications:
notifications.step1_description: Grant permission for this site to show notifications.
notifications.permission_denied_text: Notification permission denied. Please enable notifications in your browser settings.
notifications.permission_chrome_desc: Click the lock icon in the address bar ‚Üí Site settings ‚Üí Notifications
notifications.step2_description: Subscribe to receive push notifications for new messages.
notifications.subscribed_text: You are subscribed to push notifications!
notifications.unsubscribe_failed: Failed to unsubscribe from push notifications
notifications.test_description: Send a test notification to verify everything is working.
notifications.apprise_config_description: Configure Apprise to send notifications to external services like Discord, Slack, Email, SMS, and more. Apprise works over HTTP, so no HTTPS required!
notifications.apprise_about_text: Apprise supports 100+ notification services including Discord, Slack, Telegram, Microsoft Teams, Email (SMTP), SMS, and many more. Enter one service URL per line below.
notifications.apprise_urls_description: Enter Apprise notification URLs (one per line). Examples:
notifications.apprise_docs_text: for full list of supported services.
notifications.push_not_supported: Push notifications are not supported in your browser
notifications.permission_request_failed: Failed to request notification permission. Please try again.
notifications.filter_priority_order: Whitelist (highest) ‚Üí Blacklist ‚Üí Channel/DM settings. All matching is case-insensitive and checks for substrings.
notifications.https_enable_options: To enable push notifications, you must access MeshMonitor via:
notifications.pwa_not_installed: No (add to home screen for iOS)
notifications.ios_description: On iOS (iPhone/iPad), push notifications require HTTPS and PWA installation:
notifications.ios_step_share: Tap the Share button (square with arrow)
notifications.ios_step_add: Scroll down and tap "Add to Home Screen"
notifications.ios_step_open: Open MeshMonitor from your home screen

users.title: Users
users.insufficient_permissions_update: Insufficient permissions to update user permissions
users.failed_update_permissions: Failed to update permissions. Please try again.
users.failed_password_lock: Failed to update password lock status
users.password_min_length: Password must be at least 8 characters
users.failed_set_password: Failed to set password. Please try again.
users.failed_deactivate: Failed to deactivate user. Please try again.
users.password_locked_hint: Password changes are locked for this account
users.deactivate_confirm_text: Are you sure you want to deactivate user {{username}}?
users.deactivate_warning: This will revoke their access to MeshMonitor.
automation.settings_save_failed: Failed to save settings. Please try again.
automation.auto_ack.title: Auto Acknowledge
automation.auto_ack.description: When enabled, automatically reply to any message matching the RegEx pattern with a customizable template.
automation.auto_ack.tokens_info: Use tokens like {NODE_ID}, {NUMBER_HOPS}, {DATE}, {TIME}, {SNR}, and {RSSI} for dynamic content.
automation.auto_ack.regex_description: Messages matching this pattern will trigger an automatic acknowledgment. Pattern is case-insensitive.
automation.auto_ack.pattern_too_complex: Pattern too complex or may cause performance issues
automation.auto_ack.active_channels_desc: Select which channels and direct messages should have auto-acknowledge enabled
automation.auto_ack.response_delivery_de: Control how acknowledgment responses are delivered
automation.auto_ack.always_respond_dm_de: When enabled, acknowledgments will be sent as DMs regardless of which channel triggered them
automation.auto_ack.security_description: Protect against sending messages to nodes that may not be on your channel
automation.auto_ack.skip_incomplete_desc: Don't auto-acknowledge messages from nodes that are missing name or hardware info. Recommended for secure channels to avoid responding to nodes that may have overheard your encrypted traffic.
automation.auto_ack.message_multihop_des: Message to send for multi-hop messages (hop count > 0).
automation.auto_ack.message_direct_descr: Message to send for direct connections (hop count = 0). Leave empty to use the multi-hop template for all messages.
automation.auto_ack.sample_preview_multi: Shows how your acknowledgment will appear after token substitution (using example values for 3 hops)
automation.auto_ack.sample_preview_direc: Shows how your direct connection acknowledgment will appear (using example values for 0 hops)
automation.auto_ack.pattern_testing_desc: Enter sample messages (one per line) to test your regex pattern. Green = will trigger auto-ack, Red = will not trigger
automation.auto_ack.test_placeholder: Enter test messages, one per line...
automation.auto_ack.response_type_descri: Choose how to respond when a message matches the pattern. You can enable both options to send a tapback and a message.
automation.auto_ack.tapback_with_hop_cou: Send a number emoji reaction indicating the hop count (*Ô∏è‚É£ for direct, 1Ô∏è‚É£-7Ô∏è‚É£ for hops). This is a low-bandwidth way to acknowledge messages.
automation.auto_ack.reply_with_message_d: Send a customizable text message response using the templates below.
automation.auto_welcome.title: Auto Welcome
automation.auto_welcome.description: When enabled, automatically send a welcome message when a new node joins the mesh network.
automation.auto_welcome.wait_for_name_de: Wait until the node has a Long Name or Short Name before sending the welcome message. If disabled, welcome messages will be sent immediately when a new node is discovered.
automation.auto_welcome.max_hops_descrip: Only welcome nodes within this many hops (1-10). Nodes further away will not receive a welcome message.
automation.auto_welcome.broadcast_target: Select where to send the welcome message
automation.auto_welcome.message_descript: Message to send to new nodes.
automation.auto_welcome.sample_preview_d: Shows how your welcome message will appear after token substitution (using example values)
automation.auto_announce.title: Auto Announce
automation.auto_announce.description: When enabled, automatically broadcast an announcement message to a selected channel at the configured interval. Use tokens like {VERSION}, {DURATION}, {FEATURES}, {NODECOUNT}, and {DIRECTCOUNT} for dynamic content.
automation.auto_announce.channel_descrip: Select which channel to broadcast the announcement
automation.auto_announce.schedule_descri: Set the announcement schedule using cron expression
automation.auto_announce.cron_expression: Schedule format: minute hour day month weekday.
automation.auto_announce.message_descrip: Message to broadcast. Available tokens: {VERSION} (MeshMonitor version), {DURATION} (uptime), {FEATURES} (enabled features as emojis), {NODECOUNT} (active nodes), {DIRECTCOUNT} (direct nodes at 0 hops)
automation.auto_announce.sample_preview_: Shows how your announcement will appear after token substitution (using example values)
automation.auto_announce.send_failed: Failed to send announcement. Please try again.
automation.auto_announce.settings_saved_: Settings saved! Schedule changes applied immediately.
automation.auto_announce.announce_on_sta: Automatically send an announcement when the container starts (includes 1-hour spam protection to avoid network flooding)
automation.auto_announce.scheduled_sends: Use a cron expression to schedule announcements instead of a fixed interval
automation.auto_announce.interval_descri: How often to broadcast the announcement (3-24 hours). Default: 6 hours
automation.auto_announce.broadcast_chann: Select which channel to broadcast announcements on
automation.auto_traceroute.title: Auto Traceroute
automation.auto_traceroute.description: When enabled, automatically send traceroute requests to all active nodes at the configured interval. This helps maintain up-to-date network topology information. Requires container restart to take effect.
automation.auto_traceroute.schedule_desc: Set the traceroute schedule using cron expression
automation.auto_traceroute.interval_desc: How often to automatically send traceroutes to nodes. Default: 3 minutes
automation.auto_traceroute.favorites_onl: Only traceroute nodes marked as favorites
automation.auto_traceroute.max_nodes_des: Maximum number of nodes to traceroute per run
automation.auto_traceroute.min_interval_: Minimum time between traceroutes to the same node
automation.auto_traceroute.limit_to_node: When enabled, only selected nodes will be tracerouted. When disabled, all nodes are eligible.
automation.auto_traceroute.all_nodes_eli: All nodes eligible when none selected
automation.auto_traceroute.settings_save: Settings saved! Container restart required for changes to take effect.
automation.auto_traceroute.filter_descri: Use filters to automatically include nodes matching criteria. Each filter ADDS nodes to the eligible list (union logic).
automation.auto_traceroute.regex_help: Use regex patterns like .* (all), ^Base.* (starts with Base), or Router|Gateway (contains either)
theme_management.title: Custom Themes
theme_management.description: Create and manage custom color themes for the application
theme_management.get_started: Click "Create New Theme" to get started!
theme_management.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this theme?
theme_gallery.title: Theme Gallery
theme_gallery.description: Choose from {{count}} carefully crafted themes including accessibility-focused options. Click on any theme card to preview it instantly!
theme_gallery.high_contrast_desc: Our high-contrast themes provide maximum readability with WCAG AAA compliance. Perfect for users with low vision or anyone who prefers stronger color differentiation.
theme_gallery.colorblind_desc: We offer three specialized themes for different types of color blindness:
theme_gallery.protanopia_desc: For red color blindness (affects ~1% of males)
theme_gallery.deuteranopia_desc: For green color blindness (affects ~1% of males)
theme_gallery.persistence_desc: Your theme choice is saved automatically and will persist across sessions. All themes work seamlessly across all pages and components.
tileset_manager.title: Custom Tile Servers
tileset_manager.description: Add custom tile servers for offline maps or custom styling.
tileset_manager.no_tilesets_hint: Configure a local tile server (like TileServer GL) or use a custom hosted service.
tileset_manager.name_help: A friendly name for this tile server (max 100 characters)
tileset_manager.url_help: Must include {z}, {x}, {y} placeholders. Optional: {s} for subdomains
tileset_manager.tileserver_tip_title: TileServer GL Light (Recommended for Offline Maps)
tileset_manager.tileserver_tip_desc: For offline operation, use TileServer GL Light with .mbtiles files:
tileset_manager.tileserver_tip_support: Supports both vector (.pbf) and raster (.png) tiles. Light version has no native dependencies and runs on all platforms.
tileset_manager.tileserver_tip_link: View complete setup guide with Docker Compose configurator
tileset_manager.attribution_help: Attribution text to display on the map (max 200 characters)
tileset_manager.description_placeholder: Custom offline tiles for field deployment
tileset_manager.save_failed: Failed to save custom tileset. Please try again.
tileset_manager.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this custom tileset?
tileset_manager.delete_failed: Failed to delete custom tileset. Please try again.
telemetry.no_data: No telemetry data available for this node
telemetry.favorite_save_failed: Failed to save favorite. Please try again.
telemetry.purge_confirm: Are you sure you want to purge all {{type}} data for this node? This action cannot be undone.
telemetry.purge_permission_denied: Insufficient permissions to purge telemetry data
telemetry.purge_failed: Failed to purge telemetry data. Please try again.
node_details.title: Node Details
message_status.failed: Failed to send - routing error or max retries exceeded
auto_responder.title: Auto Responder
auto_responder.description: Automatically respond to messages matching your trigger patterns. Supports text responses, HTTP webhooks, and custom script execution. Scripts must be placed in /data/scripts/ (production) and can be Node.js (.js, .mjs), Python (.py), or Shell (.sh). Responses are truncated to 200 characters.
auto_responder.security_description: Protect against sending messages to nodes that may not be on your channel
auto_responder.skip_incomplete_descripti: Don't auto-respond to messages from nodes that are missing name or hardware info. Recommended for secure channels to avoid responding to nodes that may have overheard your encrypted traffic.
auto_responder.add_trigger_description: Create a trigger pattern that matches incoming messages. Use {parameter} for dynamic values, or {param:regex} for custom matching rules. Multiple patterns can be separated by commas.
auto_responder.response_text_placeholder:
Enter response text...
Use {parameter} to include matched values
Supports multi-line responses
auto_responder.clear_fields: Clear all fields in Add Trigger section
auto_responder.test_message_placeholder: Enter a test message to test pattern matching and response...
auto_responder.current_triggers_descript: Current trigger patterns and their responses
auto_responder.no_triggers_match: No triggers match your search/filter criteria
auto_responder.test_patterns_description: Test your trigger patterns with sample messages. Enter one message per line to see which patterns match and what parameters are extracted. Green = matches trigger, Red = no match. Real-time matching updates as you type.
auto_responder.no_triggers_configured: No triggers configured. Add your first trigger above to get started.
device_config.title: Device Configuration
device_config.router_warning:
Are you sure?

Setting the device role to ROUTER is generally not recommended for most users. ROUTER mode will cause your device to relay all packets, significantly increasing power consumption and airtime usage.

Click OK to confirm this change, or Cancel to keep your current setting.
device_config.device_role_description: Defines how your node behaves on the mesh network.
device_config.node_info_broadcast_descri: How often to broadcast node info. Range: 3600-4294967295 (default: 10800 = 3 hours, minimum: 3600 = 1 hour)
device_config.timezone_description: POSIX timezone definition for the device's local time display. Select a preset or enter a custom value.
device_config.timezone_custom_hint: Press Enter to use a custom POSIX timezone value
node_identity.title: Node Identity
node_identity.long_name_description: Full name for your node (up to 40 characters)
node_identity.unmessageable_description: Prevent others from sending direct messages to this node
neighbor_info.title: Neighbor Info Module
neighbor_info.enable_description: Broadcast neighbor information to the mesh
neighbor_info.interval_description: How often to send neighbor info (minimum: 14400 = 4 hours)
network_config.title: Network Configuration
network_config.ntp_server_description: Custom NTP server address (default: meshtastic.pool.ntp.org). Maximum 33 characters.
config.network_saved_toast: Network configuration saved! Device will reboot to apply changes.
lora_config.title: LoRa Radio Configuration
lora_config.modem_preset_description: Predefined radio settings balancing range and speed
lora_config.bandwidth_description: Channel bandwidth in kHz. Common values: 125, 250, 500 (31 = 31.25)
lora_config.spread_factor_description: Number of chirps per symbol (7-12). Higher = longer range, slower speed
lora_config.coding_rate_description: Denominator of coding rate (5-8). For 4/5 use 5, for 4/8 use 8
lora_config.frequency_offset_description: Advanced: Frequency offset for crystal calibration (default: 0)
lora_config.override_frequency_descripti: HAM/Advanced: Override channel calculation and use this frequency. Frequency offset still applies. Value of 0 = disabled
lora_config.region_description: Select your regulatory region for frequency/power limits
lora_config.hop_limit_description: Maximum number of hops for mesh packets. Range: 1-7 (default: 3)
lora_config.tx_power_description: LoRa transmit power in dBm. Value of 0 uses the default maximum safe power for your hardware. Units are in dBm.
lora_config.channel_num_description: LoRa channel number for frequency hopping. Range: 0-255 (default: 0)
lora_config.rx_boosted_gain_description: Enable boosted receive gain for SX126x radios (improves sensitivity but increases power consumption)
channels_config.title: Channels Configuration
channels_config.description: Meshtastic devices support up to 8 channels (0-7). Channel 0 is typically the Primary channel. You can configure each channel's name, encryption key (PSK), and uplink/downlink settings.
channels_config.psk_description: Leave empty for no encryption, or enter base64-encoded key (16 or 32 bytes)
channels_config.channel_role_description: Primary sets radio frequency; Secondary is for encryption only; Disabled turns off the channel
channels_config.position_precision_descr: Number of bits for position data (0-32). Higher = more precise. 32 = full precision.
channels_config.uplink_description: Allow gateway nodes to forward mesh messages to internet
channels_config.downlink_description: Allow internet messages to route to local mesh
channels_config.select_file_description: Choose a previously exported channel JSON file
channels_config.toast_name_too_long: Channel name must be 11 characters or less
channels_config.toast_select_file: Please select a file to import
channels_config.toast_invalid_format: Invalid import file format. Expected channel object.
mqtt_config.title: MQTT Module
position_config.title: Position Broadcast
position_config.broadcast_interval_descr: How often to broadcast position. Range: 32-4294967295 (default: 900 = 15 minutes, minimum: 32 seconds)
position_config.smart_broadcast_descript: Only broadcast when position has changed significantly
position_config.fixed_position_descripti: Node is at a fixed position (disables GPS updates)
position_config.altitude_description: Elevation above sea level in meters
export_config.title: Export Meshtastic Configuration
export_config.description: Select the channels and settings you want to include in the exported URL. The URL will be compatible with the official Meshtastic apps.
export_config.lora_config_description: Include LoRa radio settings (region, preset, hop limit, etc.)
export_config.share_url_description: Share this URL with others to import your channel configuration into their Meshtastic devices
export_config.scan_qr_description: Scan with the Meshtastic mobile app to import configuration
import_config.title: Import Meshtastic Configuration
import_config.error_reconnect_timeout: Device did not reconnect within 60 seconds
import_config.status_syncing: Configuration sent, waiting for device sync...
backup_management.title: Device Backup Management
backup_management.about_description: Device backups export your complete Meshtastic configuration in YAML format, compatible with the Meshtastic CLI --export-config command. Backups include all device settings, module configurations, and channel settings. Use these backups to restore your device configuration after a firmware update or to clone settings to another device.
backup_management.manual_description: Create an immediate backup and download it to your computer.
backup_management.auto_description: Automatically create backups daily at a specified time. Backups are saved to the server's filesystem and can be downloaded or restored later.
backup_management.no_backups: No backups found. Create your first backup using the button above.
backup_management.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete the backup "{{filename}}"?
system_backup.title: System Backup Management
system_backup.about_description: System backups export your complete MeshMonitor database including message history, node information, telemetry data, user accounts, and system settings. Each backup is a collection of JSON files with integrity checksums and version metadata. Use system backups for disaster recovery, server migration, or database rollback.
system_backup.restore_warning_descriptio: To restore a system backup, you must set the RESTORE_FROM_BACKUP environment variable and restart the container. Restores cannot be done through the UI for safety reasons.
system_backup.manual_description: Create a system backup on demand. Backup will be saved to /data/system-backups.
system_backup.auto_description: Schedule automatic system backups to run daily at a specific time.
system_backup.max_backups_hint: Older backups will be automatically deleted when this limit is exceeded.
system_backup.no_backups: No system backups found. Create one to get started!
system_backup.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete the system backup "{{dirname}}"?
auto_upgrade_test.title: Auto-Upgrade Testing
auto_upgrade_test.description_intro: Test your auto-upgrade configuration to ensure all components are properly set up.
auto_upgrade_test.config_test_descriptio: checks environment variables, file permissions, the upgrader sidecar, and more.
auto_upgrade_test.upgrade_test_descripti: performs an actual upgrade with the current version, testing backup creation, container recreation, and health checks without changing your version.
auto_upgrade_test.note_complete: Test upgrade completed successfully! The container was recreated with the same version. Check the system logs to verify everything is working correctly.
auto_upgrade_test.note_failed: Test upgrade failed. Check the error message above and the system logs for details.
auto_upgrade_test.sidecar_note: If the "Upgrader Sidecar" check fails, ensure you started MeshMonitor with both compose files:
auto_upgrade_test.toast_has_issues: Auto-upgrade configuration has issues. See details below.
auto_upgrade_test.immediate_upgrade_desc: When a new version is detected and auto-upgrade is enabled, automatically begin the upgrade without waiting for manual confirmation. Use with caution - upgrades will happen automatically as soon as a new release is available.
